body_html: TensorFlow works by first building a graph of Ops, and then running that graph once it is assembled. tf.assign adds a new assign node to the graph, which is typically run later as a side-effect of calling tf.run on some node. In your case you are adding the new node and then calling run on the newly-added node. As I said, this kind of discussion is better suited to the StackOverflow forum which is a good place for discussing TensorFlow usage.

body: TensorFlow works by first building a graph of Ops, and then running that graph once it is assembled. tf.assign adds a new assign node to the graph, which is typically run later as a side-effect of calling tf.run on some node. In your case you are adding the new node and then calling run on the newly-added node. As I said, this kind of discussion is better suited to the StackOverflow forum which is a good place for discussing TensorFlow usage.
